Context: The college offers a dance program with two specialization options: Pointe classes or Dance & Physicality classes. To be eligible for the program, students must have intermediate classical ballet level training with pointe work experience and pass an audition in ballet and jazz as well as an interview. Graduates have found employment in various industries such as traditional dance companies and festivals, project-based dance industry, film and television, dance training studio industry, dance fitness and workshop industry, sports and dance teams industry, and continued education in universities or master’s degrees. Students must successfully complete all required credits and appear in the semesters 2 and 4 showcases. Rehearsal hours for showcase preparation are scheduled in semesters 2 and 4 and range between 2 and 10 hours per week, mostly during those semesters. Production week at the theatre may also require additional hours. Students must choose their specialization (Pointe or Dance & Physicality) during their first semester and cannot switch between specializations in future semesters.

Context: Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, with a grade 12 English (C or U). For dance program applicants, they must have a minimum of intermediate level training in classical ballet for 5-7 years and pointe work experience. Mature students (19 years old or above without an OSSD) may take the Admissions Assessment for English or consider upgrading to achieve required English credits. Course exemptions are possible with college or university credits. International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and visit the International Admissions page for country-specific requirements. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. For dance program inquiries, contact Kia Kotsanis at dance@georgebrown.ca or education@balletjorgen.ca. Applicants can call the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002 for more information. International students may also contact recruitment representatives specialized by country of origin through a virtual meeting or inquiry.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Dance Performance Program P105 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: The program is offered through George Brown College's School of Media and Performing Arts and runs in partnership with Ballet Jörgen. The classes take place at Casa Loma Campus, located at 160 Kendal Ave., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Campus tours are offered regularly. Related programs include Commercial Dance (P106) and Dance Performance Preparation (P101). Students receive training in ballet, contemporary, jazz dance, vocals, acting, composition, and choreography daily. Prospective students can book campus tours or info sessions, sign up to receive tailored resources for application, and check out the virtual tour. Contact information is not provided in the text.
